4.44.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

10.04.text: Together, they make up the Eggheads,

11.88.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.32.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

23.44.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

27.12.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

31.32.text:
- Good to see you, Eggheads. 
- Nice to see you.

33.48.text:
- Good? Looking forward to this one? 
- Yeah. 
- Yes. 
- You always do.

36.56.text: Taking on our quiz champions today

38.48.text: are C3. Now, this team of friends are all members

43.20.text: They meet up every Tuesday and Wednesday. Let's meet them.

46.80.text: Hi, my name's David, and I'm a financial consultant.

49.60.text: Hi, I'm Charles, and I'm a sales consultant.

51.92.text: Hi, I'm Ed, and I'm a retail assistant.

54.28.text: Hi, I'm Dan, and I'm a play worker.

56.64.text: Hello, I'm Derek, and I'm a support worker.

59.40.text:
- So, David, team, welcome. Good to see you. 
- Thanks very much.

62.68.text: The Cardiff Chess Club. Tell us about the games you play.

65.52.text: Well, we all play in different teams within the Cardiff Chess Club,

69.08.text:
- and we all play league chess to varying levels... 
- OK.

73.92.text: CJ will be tuning in very avidly to this

76.20.text:
- cos you know he's a big chess man. 
- We do know that, yeah.

78.84.text: He once came round and showed me a load of moves. Didn't you?

81.68.text: We were up till midnight drinking coffee and me failing,

84.84.text:
- but trying, to teach you how to play chess properly. 
- Yeah.

87.40.text: That's a sort of big night in my vocabulary.

89.80.text: But anyway, you learnt chess as kids, I'm reckoning,

92.76.text: because people always seem to if they're good.

95.00.text: Well, I'm a bit unusual in that regard.

97.12.text: I started playing when I was about 21.

99.04.text: I learnt the rules, but I started playing league chess when I was 21,

101.96.text: whereas the rest of these guys have been playing

104.00.text:
- since they were nippers. 
- How long does a game normally take?

106.80.text: Depends. Some games can take three hours,

109.68.text: but if it's a foreign nations chess league game,

111.76.text: you could be talking seven hours for the full thing.

114.12.text: A real marathon. See if you can make lighter work

116.36.text:
- of this bunch over here today. 
- We'll try.

118.40.text: Every day, there is £1,000 worth of cash

120.28.text: up for grabs for our Challengers.

122.08.text: However, if they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

124.40.text: the prize money rolls over to the next show.

126.56.text: So, C3, the Eggheads have won just the last game,

129.72.text: which means £2,000 is here for you to win today. Shall we crack on?

135.16.text: The first head-to-head battle is on the subject of History.

138.20.text: Which one of you would like this?

140.36.text: I think... It's History, Derek. Is that...?

142.80.text:
- Do you want to do it? 
- Yeah, I'm pretty good at history.

147.28.text: Who do we want, though, from...?

149.24.text: Ah, let me think. They're all pretty good, aren't they?

152.28.text: A rock and a hard place, isn't it? They're all good.

154.44.text: Who's the chink in the armour? Don't know.

156.96.text: I'll go for Barry, I think,

160.40.text: because he's got the same shirt I would have worn

164.76.text: I think that's a good rationale. Fair play.

167.04.text: When you said Barry, you said it in a very Welsh way.

169.20.text:
- Did I? 
- Yes. In a lovely, lovely way. 
- Barry.

177.32.text: You're not Welsh at all, Barry, are you?

179.20.text: I'm afraid I've no Welsh blood in me at all.

181.24.text: ..Barry from the Eggheads. To ensure there's no conferring,

183.84.text: would you please take your positions in the Question Room?

187.88.text:
- Derek, good luck here on History against Barry. 
- Thank you.

190.64.text: "No man is an island except for Barry,"

192.52.text: I heard one of your team-mates say.

194.28.text: Would you like to go first or second?

203.04.text: probably the easiest question of the day.

207.52.text: What type of World War I military vehicle was the Big Willie?

217.72.text: Um, I don't think it was an aircraft because aircraft was in its infancy.

223.80.text: I don't really think it was a submarine,

226.88.text: so I'm going to go for tank.

229.00.text: Tank is quite right. Well done. Good stuff, Derek. Off the blocks.

234.52.text: did George Washington become the first president of the USA?

244.56.text: No messing. 1789 it is. You're equal. Back to you, Derek.

248.84.text: Tombstone, the site of the 1881 gunfight at the OK Corral

253.12.text: is located in which US state?

267.28.text: Could be Nevada, but I'm going to plump for Arizona.

270.40.text: Yeah, it's a toss up, isn't it, between Arizona and Nevada?

273.44.text: But you've gone the right way, Derek. Well done.

275.48.text: Arizona is the right answer. You've got two points.

278.36.text: Barry, Henry I, King of England from 1100 to 1135,

283.92.text: was a member of which royal house?

290.44.text: Henry I was a Norman, so it's Normandy.

301.00.text: primarily due to aggressive imperialistic ambitions

305.96.text: was fought between Russia and which other country?

312.36.text: Now, I do know this one,

314.32.text: so no doubt at all - it's Japan.

316.40.text: No doubt at all, it is Japan.

318.12.text: Well done. Three out of three.

319.64.text: And you made light work of that, Derek.

323.00.text: a type of cross-shaped anti-tank obstacle

325.96.text: made from iron or steel and used during the Second World War

338.96.text: I'm not sure on this one,

340.52.text: but something in the back of my brain

342.36.text: is saying that they were hedgehogs, so I'll go for Czech hedgehog.

345.88.text: Czech hedgehog is absolutely right. How about that? Three-three.

351.44.text: and we go to Sudden Death.

352.84.text: Derek, gets a bit harder. I don't give you alternatives, OK?

357.36.text: Which US president died at Warm Springs, Georgia,

361.04.text: a place he visited frequently for medical treatment?

366.36.text: Franklin D Roosevelt is correct. Barry,

369.12.text: if you get this question wrong, then you've lost

372.68.text: The major dam across the Nile that officially opened in 1971

377.20.text: is located roughly eight miles south of which city in Egypt?

381.28.text: Well, I have been to this city, so I know the answer is Aswan.

384.56.text: Aswan is the right answer. Well done.

394.84.text: That would be Sir Winston Churchill.

404.12.text: was a mutual defence alliance formed by Yugoslavia, Romania,

416.84.text: Now, let's see. The countries in the Balkans then...

420.44.text: It could, of course, have been Russia,

422.36.text: but I think not in this instance.

427.40.text: I don't think it would be Albania.

431.76.text: The answer is Turkey, so you're out, Barry.

433.96.text: Sudden Death. Derek, you got him.

435.72.text:
- Oh. 
- Well done. First blood to our Challengers.

1475.44.text: In the lyrics of The Beatles' hit Paperback Writer,

1479.44.text: "the book is based on a novel by a man named what"?

1491.20.text: Saving you the trouble of discussing it.

1493.92.text: It is "based on a novel by a man named Lear".

1499.60.text:
- Team Derek. 
- That's three out of three just like that.

1505.24.text: Just putting yourselves back together as well.

1507.76.text: In cycling, what is a bidon?

1519.24.text: I don't know. Have you got any idea, Chris? Cos I...

1521.68.text:
- I'm slightly towards water bottle. 
- Yeah, so am I, but I'm just...

1525.28.text: Is it something to do with a race number?

1527.60.text: Heard anybody refer to a race number as a bidon?

1529.96.text:
- I can't really see that. 
- No.

1531.84.text: And a safety helmet. A bidon?

1536.12.text: Given how the French mind works,

1537.88.text: it could be an upside-down bidet, couldn't it?

1540.36.text:
- Yeah, that's true. 
- Um, still want to go for water bottle?

1545.16.text:
- Yeah, I think that's probably the best. 
- Yeah.

1547.60.text:
- That was our first instinct. 
- Bidon. Bouvoir. 
- Yeah.

1552.92.text:
- Um... 
- Shall we go for that? 
- Yeah.

1555.96.text:
- Yeah. Go for it? 
- Yeah, yeah.

1559.20.text: We're not sure on this. Don't think it's a race number.

1561.96.text: We got a bit worried about safety helmet,

1564.04.text: but we both seemed to have

1566.52.text: that it might be a water bottle.

1568.00.text: I've heard the term, but can't remember what it relates to,

1574.76.text: Water bottle is the right answer.

1576.88.text: So, three each. Sorry it's not

1579.08.text: quite as straightforward as we might have hoped.

1581.68.text: We go to Sudden Death. Gets a bit more difficult.

1585.84.text:
- Here we go. Are you ready? 
- Yeah.

1587.68.text: In which 1967 novel by Angela Carter

1590.48.text: does the central character Melanie travel to London

1593.88.text: to live with her sinister Uncle Philip?

1597.56.text: The only book I know by Angela Carter

1599.96.text:
- is Nights At The Circus. 
- What is that again, sorry?

1602.72.text: Nights At The Circus is the only Angela Carter novel I know,

1605.92.text: so that's the only contribution I can...

1607.88.text:
- Is there any other...? 
- I don't know any other books.

1610.08.text:
- I have no idea, no. 
- I don't know the answer.

1612.12.text: Derek knows one book by Angela Carter,

1613.96.text: which is Nights At The Circus...

1617.64.text:
- ..so we're going to go with that. 
- OK.

1619.40.text:
- Let's see if you're right. Are they? 
- We don't know, to be honest.

1622.16.text: I don't think it's Nights At The Circus,

1624.24.text: but I may be entirely wrong about that.

1626.00.text: It may be something like Company Of Wolves.

1627.96.text: No, it's neither, actually. It's The Magic Toyshop.

1632.28.text:
- Never heard of it. 
- The Magic Toyshop, 1967.

1639.88.text: Which US state, the fifth largest in area,

1645.84.text:
- New Mexico. 
- New Mexico. 
- It's New Mexico, isn't it?

1648.24.text: That would be about the fifth biggest.

1650.28.text:
- Yeah. 
- Well, immediately east of Arizona is New Mexico.

1654.52.text: If you've got this right, you've won.

1656.68.text: Immediately east of Arizona is New Mexico.

1667.72.text: Well, that was a stinker, The Magic Toyshop.

1671.48.text: Very sorry. Hope you've enjoyed playing.

1673.52.text:
- It's been marvellous. 
- It's been a good game. 
- Been a great game.

1676.52.text: Great quizzers. You were taking them apart.

1678.52.text: The Eggheads have done what comes naturally,

1680.48.text: gained a bit of their bounce back.

1681.92.text: They reign supreme again in quiz land.

1684.08.text: It does mean you won't be going home with the £2,000,

1686.68.text: so the money rolls over to our next show.

1690.92.text: Just starting to look a little bit unbeatable again.

1694.92.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1697.36.text: have the brains to defeat the Eggheads.

1699.32.text: £3,000 says they don't. Till then, goodbye.
